content.user_title: Get Current Library Documentation via Context7 API
content.value_statement: Developers often struggle with outdated or incomplete documentation when working with software libraries. The Context7 skill connects to the Context7 API to retrieve up-to-date documentation, code examples, and API references for any supported library or framework.
actual_capabilities: Search for library IDs by library name and topic
Retrieve up-to-date documentation snippets for any supported library
Fetch code examples for specific API functions and features
Get plain text or JSON formatted documentation responses
limitations: Rate limited on the Context7 API (no API key required for basic usage)
Only covers libraries indexed by the Context7 service
Cannot execute code or modify files - read-only documentation access

prompt_templates.title: Basic Documentation Lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the context7 skill to find documentation for [LIBRARY_NAME] about [TOPIC_OR_FEATURE]

prompt_templates.title: API Example Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Use context7 to get code examples for [LIBRARY_NAME] showing how to use [SPECIFIC_API_OR_FUNCTION]
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need working code examples for an API call

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Part Query
prompt_templates.prompt: First search for [LIBRARY_NAME] with query [TOPIC], then retrieve the full documentation for the library ID you find.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to find the right library and then get its docs

prompt_templates.title: Framework Comparison

prompt_templates.scenario: When comparing how different libraries handle the same task

output_examples.output: The context7 skill returns documentation for Express.js routing including middleware usage, route handlers, and parameter passing patterns.

output_examples.input: Show me how to use pandas DataFrame operations
output_examples.output: The output includes pandas DataFrame method documentation with examples for filtering, grouping, and transforming data.
Documentation covers Docker network creation, container linking, and port publishing configuration.

best_practices: Be specific with your query parameter to get more relevant results
Use type=txt for human-readable output or type=json for programmatic use
Check multiple search results if the first one does not match your needs
anti_patterns: Do not use vague queries like "help me with Python" - be specific about the library and feature
Do not expect the skill to execute code - it only retrieves documentation
Do not rely on this for time-sensitive information that may not yet be indexed

faq.question: What libraries are supported by Context7?
faq.answer: Context7 supports a wide range of popular libraries and frameworks including React, Next.js, FastAPI, Express, Pandas, NumPy, Axios, and many others. The service continuously adds new libraries.

faq.question: Do I need an API key to use this skill?
faq.answer: No API key is required for basic usage. The Context7 API is free to use within rate limits. Higher rate limits may require an API key for production use.

faq.question: How does this differ from using training data?
faq.answer: The Context7 skill retrieves documentation that is updated continuously, ensuring you get current information rather than relying on knowledge that may be outdated from training data.

faq.question: Can I get code examples or just text documentation?
faq.answer: Both formats are available. Use type=json for structured data including code snippets, or type=txt for more readable documentation with embedded examples.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use with sensitive code?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only sends library names and topic queries to the Context7 API. No actual source code from your project is transmitted.

faq.question: What if a library is not found?
faq.answer: Try alternative names or more general search terms. If a library is not yet indexed, you may need to use official documentation sources as a fallback.
